mechanoreception.notes: Fleas likely rely on mechanoreception (e.g., bristles, sensilla) to detect vibrations and air currents produced by hosts, enabling them to locate and attach to rodents and birds.

chemoreception.notes: Fleas probably use chemoreception to detect host odors and other chemical cues that guide them to suitable hosts. This helps them in host selection and finding feeding sites.

thermoreception.notes: Fleas likely use thermoreception to detect the body heat of potential hosts, which aids in locating warm-blooded animals.

vision.notes: The extent of visual capability in Ceratophyllidae is not clearly defined in provided context. May be rudimentary or absent.
